channel.title: Drove into someone, what do
channel.description:
Just what I needed, ran into the back of someone today, albeit at only about 5mph (traffic jammed), I was scared shitless and he indicated to pull over so I did the same, not knowing what to do, and he got out so well, I did too.
He looked at me and then inspected his car, touched it a bit, absolutely no damage, I did the same, all good in the hood. So then he asked for registration and insurance numbers, I questioned him why for a bit, he responded with 'oh I'll get it checked over at the garage and if there's anything wrong with it I'll get back to you' and just gave in, again, I am clueless in these situations.
I wrote down his registration too, y'know just in case, but he took my name, phone no (insurance docs were at home), and car reg.
I was deeply apologetic and all cause well, it was my fault, but what should I have done anyone? Again, never been in this situation at all before.
ps. I drive a micra k11 sport.

item.title: Drove into someone, what do
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:55, topic:445112”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=547798.msg4028834#msg4028834 date=1340565029]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=547798.msg4028025#msg4028025 date=1340501552]

The one things that pisses me off the most is that in either a 30mpg area or 35mph area people will still be on your ass even though you take the 5mpg extra most cops allow you to go… So most of the time I low back down to the real speed limit to piss those people off.

I also have to agree with Phillipe the 2 second rule is useless even 3 seconds, now that Ive bought a car worth ($18,000) I feel my stomach fall when I see people behind me on their phone or eating, most people when they drive are complete morons and have no respect for others.
[/quote]Miles per gallon?

Opps you caught me.

I would gladly take 30mpg, but my v6 brings it down to a lovely 26…
[/quote]i get 58mpg umad

I have 425hp and 425ft/lbs of torque, are you mad?

I can turn corners in my car

I’m almost certain my car can turn corners better than yours as well, 2007 Dodge Charger SRT8.[/quote]
your wife’s forum name is your car’s model name?


^decent looking car

Read full topic

item.title: Drove into someone, what do
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Teh Spede:

I drive a hatchback Toyota Corolla and don’t care about torque or horsepower so no I’m not mad since gas is a little under 1.7€/l here.

I call b/s, you ain’t getting 4l/100km out of a corolla, maybe 5.5 if it is a pre 2000 model but definitely not on the newer models. The newer ones use 7+L/100km, you claim to be in prius territory.

My 1988 Corolla 4A-GE uses usually 7l/100km but down to 5.9L/100km on long trips.

Read full topic

item.title: Drove into someone, what do
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:44, topic:445112”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=547798.msg4027395#msg4027395 date=1340460029]

[quote author=Jmood link=topic=547798.msg4026918#msg4026918 date=1340410054]

The one things that pisses me off the most is that in either a 30mpg area or 35mph area people will still be on your ass even though you take the 5mpg extra most cops allow you to go… So most of the time I low back down to the real speed limit to piss those people off.

I also have to agree with Phillipe the 2 second rule is useless even 3 seconds, now that Ive bought a car worth ($18,000) I feel my stomach fall when I see people behind me on their phone or eating, most people when they drive are complete morons and have no respect for others.
[/quote]Miles per gallon?

Opps you caught me.

I would gladly take 30mpg, but my v6 brings it down to a lovely 26…
[/quote]i get 58mpg umad

I have 425hp and 425ft/lbs of torque, are you mad?

@the 2 second rage
I hate that too. My heart is always pounding like crazy when I see some fuck tailgating me, I just speed up if there’s nobody in front of me to get the hell away from them or switch lanes.

You should always leave enough space in front of you to stop no matter what happens with the car in front of you, there is no hard and fast rule that will work everywhere and there never really can be, you know how long your car takes to stop under what conditions and should take that into account.

As far as someone tailgating me real close goes, what I do is just take my foot off the gas, so that I very slowly slow down enough so that they get the point. Then I speed back up and usually they stay back, realizing they were too close. Sometimes if they are real assholes they go to pass you, and depending on your attitude at the time or type of car you are in, you can either let them pass, or stomp on the gas and leave them far behind.[/quote]

Yes I am once again mad, because I don’t even break the 300 barrier. -.-

Read full topic

The one things that pisses me off the most is that in either a 30mpg area or 35mph area people will still be on your ass even though you take the 5mpg extra most cops allow you to go… So most of the time I low back down to the real speed limit to piss those people off.

I also have to agree with Phillipe the 2 second rule is useless even 3 seconds, now that Ive bought a car worth ($18,000) I feel my stomach fall when I see people behind me on their phone or eating, most people when they drive are complete morons and have no respect for others.
[/quote]Miles per gallon?

Opps you caught me.

I would gladly take 30mpg, but my v6 brings it down to a lovely 26…
[/quote]i get 58mpg umad[/quote]
I have 425hp and 425ft/lbs of torque, are you mad?

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:43, topic:445112”]@the 2 second rage
I hate that too. My heart is always pounding like crazy when I see some fuck tailgating me, I just speed up if there’s nobody in front of me to get the hell away from them or switch lanes.[/quote]

You should always leave enough space in front of you to stop no matter what happens with the car in front of you, there is no hard and fast rule that will work everywhere and there never really can be, you know how long your car takes to stop under what conditions and should take that into account.

As far as someone tailgating me real close goes, what I do is just take my foot off the gas, so that I very slowly slow down enough so that they get the point. Then I speed back up and usually they stay back, realizing they were too close. Sometimes if they are real assholes they go to pass you, and depending on your attitude at the time or type of car you are in, you can either let them pass, or stomp on the gas and leave them far behind.

Read full topic

item.title: Drove into someone, what do
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

runescape3dude:

What I don’t get is that, if stopping distance is longer in rain for you, wouldn’t it also be longer for them, negating the need for a greater time gap? It is probably more to do with the fact that you will take longer to react when it is raining, due to poor visibility…

on paper it seems the longer braking would negate the need for a longer stopping distance but in the real world there’s more variables when it’s wet than when it’s dry hence the need for a longer stopping distance

some of those variables include different tyres providing different amounts of grip when wet, some brake pads not being as efficient as they can be when wet, poor visibility, diesel on tyres (although this is mostly for motorbikes) etc

Read full topic
